result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AMENDED

Defendant to presign Waiver of Extradition.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Not to discuss case with Yazmine R.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, any Fleet Farm in Wisconsin.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Cross by Atty. Harrelson.  Cross by Atty. Petersen. Redirect by ADA Brekken.  On 22CF22-   Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  On 22CF23-   Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court will proceed with ARGN in both matters.  22CF23- ADA Brekken states information will mirror complaint.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on both counts.  Waives speedy trial.
